projects.name: SHVM.in
projects.summary: AI-first portfolio acting as a digital twin — this very system.
projects.problem: Traditional portfolios are static pages. This is an interactive engineering brain that hosts can query via MCP.
projects.architecture: Edge-native React application (TanStack Start on Cloudflare Workers) with retrieval-augmented generation. Embeds an MCP server so external hosts can programmatically query portfolio data.
projects.tradeoffs: Full-stack rendered at the edge — requires careful hydration and SSR management. AI context is deterministic, not hallucinated.
notable_decisions: Used TanStack Start over Next.js for tighter Cloudflare Workers integration
MCP server is self-contained within the same deployment
Static JSON data layer for deterministic tool outputs

projects.name: Liva
projects.summary: Real‑time collaborative whiteboards + AI brainstorming. Create, organize, and revisit collaborative whiteboards with premium real‑time syncing powered by Cloudflare Durable Objects.
projects.problem: Ideas move from sketch → discussion → execution without context switching.
projects.architecture: Real‑time multiplayer boards using a Durable Object per board. WebSocket‑based sync with deterministic state handling.
notable_decisions: Real‑time multiplayer boards (Durable Object per board)
WebSocket‑based sync with deterministic state handling
AI conversation layer integrated into the workspace
Browser-based rendering with scalable edge infrastructure

projects.name: Monorail
projects.summary: Browser-first voice/video/audio recording pipeline. A multi-channel recording + upload system designed so data is uploaded while recording, eliminating data loss risk.
projects.problem: Traditional recording systems risk data loss if the browser crashes or the upload fails after recording.
projects.architecture: Live chunk upload during recording (no post-recording risk). Browser-native architecture with multi-track capture.
notable_decisions: Live chunk upload during recording (no post-recording risk)
Voice, video, and audio multi-track capture
Integrated processing pipeline for transcription and publishing

projects.name: shvm-db
projects.summary: Serverless NoSQL database on Durable Objects. A DynamoDB-compatible NoSQL database implemented on Cloudflare Durable Objects + SQLite, designed for strong consistency and horizontal scale.
projects.problem: Edge-native strongly consistent storage without traditional database infrastructure.
projects.architecture: Deterministic routing with consistent hashing, leader-replica design for read scalability, and append-only versioned storage architecture.
projects.tradeoffs: Strong consistency prioritized over global eventual consistency. Edge-native data locality.

projects.name: DIN
projects.summary: A calmer personal assistant for daily life. DIN learns from life instead of task lists. It captures unstructured notes, detects patterns, and nudges thoughtful progress.
projects.problem: Mental overhead and pressure from traditional productivity tools.
projects.architecture: Local-first architecture (offline-first via IndexedDB) with sync through edge workers.
notable_decisions: Minimal interaction design focused on calm productivity

projects.problem: Reading system design content is not the same as being able to design under pressure.
projects.architecture: Progressive mastery tracking with active recall + spaced repetition principles.
notable_decisions: 7 levels from recognition to interview-ready thinking
Built around active recall + spaced repetition principles

projects.name: Backflare
projects.summary: Privacy-first edge backup platform. An open-source backup system that snapshots, versions, and restores Google Drive data using Cloudflare’s edge infrastructure.
projects.problem: Secure, versioned backups without simple storage sync risks.
projects.architecture: Edge-native architecture with Durable Objects + R2. Client-side encryption ensures privacy.
notable_decisions: Versioned backups instead of simple storage sync
Edge-native architecture with Durable Objects + R2

projects.name: Vani
projects.summary: Cloudflare-native voice session runtime + client SDK. Stateful, resumable voice conversations backed by Durable Objects, with a shared client/server contract and a headless+UI client package.
projects.problem: Shipping reliable voice UX is hard when session state, streaming, and UI are all loosely coupled. Vani makes the session a first-class primitive with a typed contract.
projects.motivation: I wanted a minimal, self-hostable alternative for voice agents that keeps latency low, state deterministic, and the client/server contract shared — without building a full telephony platform.
projects.cost_notes: The goal is to make the control plane cheap and push cost into model usage (STT/LLM/TTS). Exact cost depends on models, audio volume, and concurrency.

comparisons.vapi: Vapi is a managed voice agent platform. Vani is lower-level: you own deployment, choose models, and keep a simple typed websocket contract.
comparisons.livekit: LiveKit is real-time media infrastructure (rooms/SFU/WebRTC). Vani is a per-session agent runtime over websocket + Durable Object state.

projects.architecture: A websocket route (/ws/:sessionId) fans into a Durable Object per session. The session machine orchestrates STT/LLM/TTS via Workers AI, persisting transcript/history in DO SQLite for recoverability.
notable_decisions: Transcript/history persisted in DO SQLite for recovery
Headless hook + optional UI client package
